definition: Pleistocene (geological epoch from 2m years ago, covering the most recent ice ages)
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: Fault depression took place in Pliocene and the Qinghai Lake formed in Middle Pleistocene.
sentences.chinese: 上新世出现断陷，中更新世成湖。

sentences.english: There was lake development during late Pleistocene in the Yanhuai basin.
sentences.chinese: 延怀盆地晚更新世发育湖相沉积。

sentences.english: Stage 3, early Pleistocene, anticlockwise rotation of Luzon arc and continent-arc collision.
sentences.chinese: 更新世，吕宋弧逆时针转动和弧陆碰撞阶段。

sentences.english: It has been shaped by the Pleistocene Glaciation.
sentences.chinese: 东海岸是在更新世的冰川作用下形成的。

sentences.english: The Upper Pleistocene in northern Hebei is divisible into the Qian an Formation and the Malan Formation.
sentences.chinese: 冀北晚更新世地层划分为迁安组与马兰组。

sentences.english: In middle pleistocene there were widespread lakes and swamps.
sentences.chinese: 中更新世本区湖沼广布。

sentences.english: The floor of Goat Paddock Crater is covered by sediments deposited since the Pleistocene Epoch.
sentences.chinese: 山羊围场陨石坑的地面覆盖着自更新世以来的沉积物。

sentences.english: The development of Benxi water cave started from the middle Pleistocene, about 400000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 本溪水洞的发育起始于中更新世，即约40万年前。

sentences.english: The environment of the Lop Nur Lake was fluctuant since Late Pleistocene.
sentences.chinese: 晚更新世以来湖泊沈积环境波动变化加快。

sentences.english: The age of the redefined Daotang Formation is mid-late Pleistocene.
sentences.chinese: 新厘定的道堂组的地质时代为中晚更新世。

sentences.english: The same may be said for the emergence of human modernitytoward the end of the Pleistocene.
sentences.chinese: 更新世末期，现代人的崛起也是这样。

sentences.english: Inthe early middle pleistocene, the karst caves in Yangchun area began to develop.
sentences.chinese: 在中更新世早期，阳春地区的岩溶洞穴开始发育。

sentences.english: Xijiang riverbed has obviously superimposed since Middle Pleistocene Epoch at latest.
sentences.chinese: 最晚自中更新世以来西江河床叠置很明显。

sentences.english: Its horizon is equivalent to the lower of the Dingcun Formation and its age is early Late Pleistocene.
sentences.chinese: 其层位相当于丁付组下部，时代为晚更新世早期。

sentences.english: The developmental process of landform and the origin of sediments on the Tianchi lake dam are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 简述了更新世以来的地貌发育过程。

definition: Holocene (geological period covering approx 12000 years since the last ice age)
fourth period/quaternary (geological period covering the recent ice ages over the last 180,000 years)
Paleozoic, geological era 545-250m years ago, covering Cambrian 寒武紀|寒武纪, Ordovician 奧陶紀|奥陶纪, Silurian 志留紀|志留纪, Devonian 泥盆紀|泥盆纪, Carboniferous 石炭紀|石炭纪, Permian 二疊紀|二叠纪
third period/tertiary (geological era since the extinction of the dinosaurs at the Cretaceous-Tertiary boundary 65 million years ago)
pre-Cambrian, geological period before c. 540m years ago
